DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this work is to evaluate which of the two types of operation (traditional/open and laparoscopic) has more impact on patients who were operated electively due to their chronic calculous cholecystitis.
DOC.brief_title: Extent of Surgical Trauma in Open and Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy
DOC.detailed_description: The prospective, single center, randomized study includes 120 patients who are operated electively - 60 patients operated laparoscopically and 60 patients operated traditionally. Biohumoral and endocrine parameters of response to trauma are determined from 24 hour urine and blood: adrenalin, noradrenalin, metabolites of corticosteroid hormone - 17- hydroxyl and 17- keto steroid (HPLC method), C reactive protein and albumin, glycemia, creatine phosphokinase, lactate dehydrogenase, sedimentation of erythrocytes and serum concentration of potassium.
DOC.criteria: Chronic Calculous Cholecystitis Previous Biliary Surgery Cholangitis Obstructive jaundice
